markdownRemark.html:
Score: 92.5

tucson.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of The Arizona Daily Star, a daily newspaper serving Tucson and southern Arizona.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

Tucson.com is jointly owned by the Gannett Company Inc. and Lee Enterprises. Gannett is a publicly traded company that owns more than 100 news organizations around the country, including its flagship publication USA Today. Those news sites make up the USA Today Network, which Gannett formed in 2015. Lee Enterprises is a publicly traded Iowa-based company that publishes more than 40 daily newspapers, including The St. Louis Post-Dispatch. The site runs advertising and sells digital subscriptions.

Content

Tucson.com covers news, sports, and entertainment focusing on southern Arizona, near the Mexican border. Staples of coverage include crime, the federal Border Patrol, and extreme weather. The site has a separate section called Wildcats on team sports from the University of Arizona. Interactive maps, part of a feature titled “How Safe Is Your Neighborhood,” allow users to search for crime news by location.

The site carries original reporting along with reports from other news providers, including The  Associated Press. Content is limited to a select number of articles a month for users who do not buy digital subscriptions.

Credibility

Articles are fact-based, with reporting backed by credible sources and data. Headlines accurately reflect the content of stories. The site clearly distinguishes opinion writing from news coverage. Tucson.com does not post a corrections policy, but NewsGuard found examples of corrections, listed on a separate page with the error explained.

Transparency

The site has a Contact Us section that lists top editors and their contact information. Many, but not all articles, include the name of the writer, and biographical information is provided for some contributors.

 Information about the site’s ownership is not posted clearly on the site. Tucson.com did not respond to three phone calls and two emails from NewsGuard inquiring into the site’s lack of disclosure about its ownership, and its policies on identifying content creators. Advertising is clearly distinguished from news.

History

The Arizona Daily Star was founded in 1877. The website was launched in 1994, according to domain ownership records. 

Written by:
Ivana Rihter

Edited by:
Amy Westfeldt Jim Warren
